terms.definition: The specific set of laws, typically from a designated jurisdiction, that will be used to interpret and enforce the terms of a contract.
A formal phrase signaling the end of a legal document, indicating that the parties have signed it to show their agreement.
A contract outlining the terms between a hiring party and a self-employed individual providing services, clarifying the non-employee relationship.
A word used in legal documents to transition from background statements to the operative provisions or agreements.
A word used in legal documents to introduce the conclusion or operative part that follows from the preceding statements.
A word used to introduce a background statement or a reason for what follows in a legal document.
Previously mentioned or referred to in the document.
A person authorized to act on behalf of another person or company in business dealings.

terms.term: as of the date first above written
terms.definition: Effective from the date mentioned at the very beginning of the legal document.
A clause in a contract specifying which state's or country's laws will be used to interpret and enforce the agreement.
Rules used by courts to determine which jurisdiction's laws apply when the laws of multiple jurisdictions could potentially govern a case.
Interpreted or understood according to the rules or laws of a particular place or standard.
Included or found within this document.
Signed and formally put this legal document into effect.
In exchange for or because of something, often referring to what one party gives to another in a contract.
A self-employed person hired to perform work for others, without being considered an employee.
A person or entity involved in a temporary business undertaking or project with another, typically sharing risks and profits.

terms.term: made and entered into as of
terms.definition: Officially created, signed, and effective starting from a specific date.
Agreements and commitments made by both parties to each other within a contract.
An individual who shares in a business with one or more others, typically sharing profits, losses, and management.
The main office or location where a business's executive decisions are made and its primary operations are conducted.
Will begin or start.
Confidential business information that gives a company a competitive edge and is protected by law from unauthorized disclosure.

terms.term: upon providing thirty (30) days written notice
terms.definition: After giving a formal written announcement or warning 30 days in advance.
